1.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is packing her belongings to move to Ross’s.NEWLINEShe’s standing in the kitchen.

lines.Line: So, which of this kitchen stuff is mine
This bottle opener. (She grabs it off of the freezer door.
How weird is that? Y’know? You’re moving in with me and have theNEWLINEone thing I don’t have. It’s like uh, in a way you-you complete meNEWLINE(Phoebe glares at him) kitchen
(in an Australian accent) You complete me kitchen, matey
Ross, I know what you’re thinking
Ross, I know what you’re thinking

That she’s gonna move in with you and maybe then she’ll fallNEWLINEin love with you and then when she finds out you’re already married, she’ll justNEWLINEbe happy. Y’know? You’re just, you’re very sad
Oh…my…God! I-I see what this is! You are in love withNEWLINERachel

Of course! It all adds up! I mean you you’re obsessed with her.NEWLINEIt’s always, Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel? Ross,NEWLINEwhy-why are you moving in with Rachel? When are you gonna confess your secretNEWLINEmarriage to Rachel? You want her
(answering it) Uh-oh, saved by the bell. (On phone) Hello

Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say
Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say
Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say
Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say

I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean it’sNEWLINEtemporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would thatNEWLINElook great on a mailbox, huh? Professor Geller
Oh! Yeah, y’know you and Ross are still married
Ohh! Oh God! (Laughs her way into the living room.)

2.SceneDescription: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is playing that string game with the two hands andNEWLINEthe weird crossing patterns as Chandler enters with the mail.

lines.Line: Yes, you got something from the Screen Actor’s Guild
Ooh, it’s probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me,NEWLINEI’m kinda…
Hmm that’s weird. I don’t remember being in a move calledNEWLINEbenefits lapsed
Okay, it’s not a check. They’re saying your health insuranceNEWLINEexpired because, you didn’t work enough last year
(reads it) Oh, I can’t believe this! This sucks! When I had insuranceNEWLINEI could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, y’know? And it wouldn’t matter. Now INEWLINEgotta be careful?
I’m sorry man, there’s never a good time to (pauses) stopNEWLINEcatching on fire
All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. I’m gonna go see myNEWLINEagent
All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. I’m gonna go see myNEWLINEagent
Okay, make sure you look both ways before you cross the street
(mocks him, in a whiney voice) …look both ways before you cross theNEWLINEstreet. (Turns and walks headlong into the closed door.

3.SceneDescription: Estelle Leonard Theatrical Agency, Joey is there to see his agent.

lines.Line: Well! Well! Well! Joey Tribbiani! So you came back huh? They thinkNEWLINEthey can do better but they all come crawling back to Estelle
What are you talkin’ about? I never left you! You’ve always beenNEWLINEmy agent
Oh well, no harm, no foul
Estelle, you gotta get me some work. I-I lost my health insurance
All right, first thing we gotta do, damage control
All right, first thing we gotta do, damage control
Well, I think uhh, someone out there may have been bad mouthing you allNEWLINEover town

4.SceneDescription: a NYU lecture hall, Rachel and Monica are arriving to talk to Ross after theNEWLINElecture, but are there early.

lines.Line: Well, we’re a little early, the lecture doesn’t end for 15NEWLINEminutes
Yeah, but y’know we could sneak in and watch
Yeah, we could. Oh hey look! There’s some Kappa Kappa Deltas! I wasNEWLINEa Kappa. (to them) Hey sisters! (They ignore her.) (To Monica) Wow, we really are bitches

lines.Character: (They enter the lecture hall to find Ross speaking in an English accent for someNEWLINEunknown reason

(to the class) Right! So when Rigby got his samples back from theNEWLINElaboratory he made a startling discovery! What he believed to be igneous, was in factNEWLINEsedimentary. Imagine his consternation when—(sees Monica and Rachel.) Oh bloody hell

5.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler is reading on the couch while Joey, still suffering fromNEWLINEhis hernia, is returning with coffee for them both. After a series of grunts and groans heNEWLINEmanages to painfully walk back from the counter, sit down, and slide Chandler his coffee.

lines.Line: Hey, will you grab me a cruller? (Joey starts to groan and get up.)NEWLINESit down! Will you go to the hospital?
Dude! Hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. Besides it’sNEWLINEgetting darker and more painful, that means it’s healing
I will loan you the money. Just go to the hospital and let’s justNEWLINEget that thing…pushed back in

Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and INEWLINEdon’t want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks inNEWLINEI can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, I’m thinking I’ll probably startNEWLINEwith that laser eye surgery too
Oh Joey’s got a really bad hernia, but that’s nothing aNEWLINElittle laser eye surgery won’t fix
Look, I’m telling you if I put my hand on my stomach right here (HeNEWLINEputs his hand down his pants, like Al Bundy on Married…With Children alwaysNEWLINEused to do.) it doesn’t hurt that bad
No, we can go together! Just don’t wait too long though, okay?NEWLINE‘Cause I’m outta here sometime before Friday
Yeah, but I don’t wanna die
Yeah, but I don’t wanna die
Yeah, but I don’t wanna die
No-no, it’ll be fun! We can come back and we can haunt these guys

6.SceneDescription: Casting Director #1’s office, Joey is on his first audition. His partnerNEWLINEis an 8-year-old boy.

lines.Line: (in a gravely, painful voice) Okay. Hey, Timmy, I’ve got aNEWLINEsurprise for you
Hold it. I’m sorry, the surprise is a new swing set,NEWLINEif you could play it a little less…intense

Oh yeah, sure, no problem, I’ll just—hold on one second. (HeNEWLINEturns around and puts his hand in his pants and groans in relief.) (In a relaxed voice.)NEWLINEHey Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you

lines.Character: (Joey pulls his hand out and reverts back to intense pain
lines.Line: Joey pulls his hand out and reverts back to intense pain.

7.SceneDescription: Casting Director #3’s office, Joey is entering.

lines.Line: Hi. I’m Joey Tribbiani; I’m here to audition for (Groans) man

8.SceneDescription: Silvercup Studios, Joey has won the part of dying man and is now able to playNEWLINEthe role he was injured for. Chandler is helping to carry him in.

lines.Line: Listen, I’m really glad you got the part
(barely audible through the pain) Thank you
But are you sure you can do this
But are you sure you can do this
Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping meNEWLINEtake a shower
Now, is that never talking about it again?
Hey Joey, we’re ready for ya! (Joey stumbles over) Joey, thisNEWLINEis Alex he’s going to be playing your son
Hi Alex! (to the director) And uh, as you can see my hands are not in myNEWLINEpants. (Holds them both up.
Okay. (to Alex) All right uh, Alex now when Joey says his line,NEWLINETake good care of your Momma son, that’s your cue to cry. Got it? (AlexNEWLINEnods yes.) All right, let’s do this
Joey lies down on the gurney.
Joey lies down on the gurney.
Joey lies down on the gurney.
Joey lies down on the gurney.
Joey lies down on the gurney.

Take could care of your Momma son. (Alex just looks at him andNEWLINEthe director motions for him to continue so he tries it again.) Take could care ofNEWLINEyour Momma son. (Alex does nothing.) Come on son! Your Momma’s goodNEWLINEpeople
Cut! Alex, remember you’re supposed to cry. Can you cry forNEWLINEus this time
All right! Let’s try this again! You ready Joe
Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream rightNEWLINEup until you say action
(he stops screaming at action) Take good care of your MommaNEWLINEson. (Again Alex does nothing.
I’m sorry! Hey-hey Joe, why don’t you uh, lift up yourNEWLINEshirt? (He does.) Take a look at this kiddo. (Alex finally starts crying.) WeNEWLINEhave a crying child! Roll the damn cameras

9.SceneDescription: a NYU lecture hall, Ross is trying to phase out his accent.

lines.Line: (in his head) All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out,NEWLINEphasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory (pronouncedNEWLINEthe British way) the team would never have identified (British) the initial errors inNEWLINEtheir carbon dating analysis (British). Were there any questions at this point? (OneNEWLINEstudent raises his hand.) Yes. (Points to him.

(British) Come again? What’s-what’s this nonsense? (Giggles.)NEWLINE(American.) All right, I’m-I’m not English. I’m from Long Island. I wasNEWLINEreally nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. I’m sorry. So, if we could justNEWLINEget back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? (Everyone raises their hands)NEWLINEAbout paleontology. (They all put their hands down.) All right, look I was just trying toNEWLINEmake a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me isNEWLINEreally important because I’m-I’m hoping to get a permanent job here. So if youNEWLINEjust give me another chance to make a good impression

lines.Character: (At this moment Rachel bursts through the door. Needless to say, she’s not in theNEWLINEbest of moods having just found out Ross’s dirty little secret
lines.Line: At this moment Rachel bursts through the door. Needless to say, she’s not in theNEWLINEbest of moods having just found out Ross’s dirty little secret.
